page.title: 17Two Schools Get Together
page.content: Because of falling rolls at both schools,the twenty-four junior aged pupils from Taddington and Ashford schools have met for Environmental Studies at Monsal Dale where their parish boundaries meet.With specialist help of graduates on the temporary staff of the Peak National Park Board the rambles included river dipping in the R.Wye,as well as other ecological aspects.A seconded headteacher helped with bird identification and arranged for the firing of clay models made as a result of the three dale meetings.A walk along the Monsal Trail-converted from the former railway track-included looking at past mining activities and led to a joint visit to the Leadmining Museum and the Nestus Mine at Matlock Bath.Picnics,sketching on the river bank,and a P.E.lesson have also been among the much enjoyed activities.
